welcome.title: Welcome!
welcome.instruction: Welcome to Daily Rambam! This short tutorial will show you how to use the app. You'll learn swipe gestures and navigation.

swipeRight.title: Swipe Right
swipeRight.instruction: Swipe right on each card to mark it as complete. Try all 3 cards!
swipeRight.hint: Swipe right on the highlighted card

swipeLeft.title: Undo - Swipe Left
swipeLeft.instruction: Swipe left on a completed card to mark it as incomplete. Try it on any green card.
swipeLeft.hint: Swipe left on a completed card

markAll.title: Mark All Previous
markAll.instruction: Swipe left on an incomplete card to mark it AND all previous cards as complete. Great for catching up!

doubleTap.title: Double Tap
doubleTap.instruction: You can also double-tap a card to toggle its read status. Quick and easy!

infoIcon.title: More Information
infoIcon.instruction: Each halakha has an info button (ⓘ) that opens external links to Sefaria, Chabad.org, and more. You can also long-press any card to access this.
infoIcon.hint: Tap the info icon or long-press

dayCheckmark.title: Mark Day Complete
dayCheckmark.instruction: Use the checkmark (✓) on each day's header to mark all halakhot in that day as complete at once. Perfect for catching up!

jumpButton.title: Jump to Incomplete
jumpButton.instruction: Use this blue button to quickly scroll to your next incomplete halakha. It appears when you have unread items.

calendar.title: Calendar
calendar.instruction: Use the calendar button in the header to jump to any date. View past or future halakhot by selecting a date.

settings.title: Settings
settings.instruction: Access settings to customize text language, study path, and more. You can also download content for offline use.

headerColors.title: Header Colors
headerColors.instruction: The accent bar under the header changes color to indicate your status. The color adapts to your chosen theme.
headerColors.hint: Colors help you know your current state at a glance

bookmarks.title: Bookmarks
bookmarks.instruction: Save any halakha to your bookmarks! Tap the ⓘ button on any card, then tap 'Add to bookmarks'. You can also add personal notes.
bookmarks.hint: Use the bookmark button in the header to view all your saved items

summaries.title: Daily Summary
summaries.instruction: At the bottom of each day's halakhot, you'll find a 'What I Learned' section. Write a short reflection to help remember what you studied.
summaries.hint: Summaries appear after you complete some halakhot

sharing.title: Share Progress
sharing.instruction: Share your learning journey! After writing a summary, tap the share button to share your progress with friends and family.
sharing.hint: Sharing includes your progress stats and daily reflection

complete.instruction: You now know all the basics! Start your daily Rambam study. Swipe cards as you read, and track your progress.
